storyInfo: More and more people begin to awaken. Patrizion and the others begin to resist. Exusiai manages to defeat the First Saint. PCS reveals its plan, but Federico and Andoain point out its self-contradictory nature, and destroy it.

attributes.content: The 'Saint' drags her massive body along as she walks at the head of the procession. The Sankta named Lemuel jumps around, pulling out gun after gun like prestidigitation, raining a hail of gunfire onto her quarry.
But the 'Saint' barely even spares her a glance.
Her halo shimmers, and despite the great distance separating them, Patrizion still hears her 'voice' with perfect clarity.
Their empathy is growing stronger, which means their long journey approaches its end.
Allow our other cohorts to take care of your friend's remains, Patrizion. We do not need to mourn him.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Your Beatitude...
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Do you still remember that arborbeast fledgling?
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: If we reach our destination, Laterano shall recreate the miracle of life once more. Every miracle, freely performed.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: You mean...?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: And so, we move onwards.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: The grand procession passes statues after statue, workshop after workshop. The city grows brighter, step by step, pace by pace.
Patrizion walks forward in silence.
S... Stop.
A young gunsmith's apprentice walks against the flow of people, stopping in front of Patrizion. Vannini stares down the gun-knight, many times taller than her. She raises her gun against him.
The crowd parts around them, but none look toward them. Vannini bites her lip, doing her best to stop her hand from trembling.
Ah, you are his apprentice, yes?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Magister Paganini... Where is he?
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: He...
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: He warned me. So in the dream, I-I... hid in the workshop. After I awoke, I still hesitated for so long...
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: Right now, you're... scary. Laterano's scary. I don't know what's going on, I don't even have a patron firearm...
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: But I can't just hide and wait...
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: So you made yourself that gun and came to stop me?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: That's very brave of you.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: But do you see this procession, my child? We will birth a miracle, one that nearly all Laterans will be a part of.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: It's not 'scary'.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: (Shakes head) That's got... nothing to do with me.
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: I'm not very... good with words. I couldn't... couldn't think of any worse ones...
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: Magister Paganini was... my only family...
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: My only... connection... to Laterano...
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: Your only connection, huh...?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Pag, you never got a halo in the dream, so why did you join the procession?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: To find a chance to kill you, obviously.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: That sniper, your old student?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Tragic, isn't it?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Worse than when Gia left?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: You still going to listen to that monster? Going to keep protecting the crowd on this walk?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Don't think I don't know what you're thinking.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: The Laterano of fifty years ago forced you to banish an infected Liberi. The Laterano of ten years ago forced you to banish a fallen gun-knight.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Even your granddaughter is far too stubborn and opinionated. Who knows if someday, she too will...
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: So, you hope for a better Laterano?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: You want it to be like a doctor who becomes a miracle worker, able to treat Oripathy, able to fix personality flaws, able to make everyone accept one another, no questions asked?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: That way, no more sad farewells like you've suffered through before?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: *cough*... You're a coward through and through, Patrizion!
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Farewells are like melted ice cream and worn-out guns. Doesn't matter what you do, it's bound to happen, right?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Even if you can't stop them from happening, you can still give your well-wishes. A simple 'goodbye' is all you need.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: It's not like you have a speech impediment like Vannini. Is it so hard to find a way to shed some of your regret?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Enough talk! Just hang on!
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Hang on, my feathery ass—*cough*—This is... a bullet that can cut right through gun-knight armor...
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Don't touch me. Let me finish, otherwise I'll step into the grave that much quicker.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: A-Alright then...
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: What's with the tone? Don't even think about getting sentimental on me, Patrizion!
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Why do you think I saved you?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Don't jabber at me about calamity or crisis or what path Laterano should take...
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: If the city really is going to be destroyed, surely we can do more than just leave it to some monster from beyond our nightmares that sprang up out of nowhere?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Aurela, Fiammetta, all those other Laterans you know... Are these connections that weak to you?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: You're a gun-knight, you stulte! The best gun-knight in all of Laterano!
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*—
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Paganini gets more intense the more he rambles, but his voice grows quieter by the second.
Patrizion holds his old friend tight, feeling the warmth slowly drain out of him, as though the last dregs of his life had spilled out with his latest outburst.
Hey, not going to say anything?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Never mind then. Before, at the Shrine, I said we never actually shared anything these past few decades...
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Now, at the very least... That regret's gone.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: My magister, he...
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: Forgive me. I couldn't even give you one final moment with Pag.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: *sob*—
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: Vannini, i-if you had just... been a bit quicker... making this gun, if you had just gotten here quicker...
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: Vannini lowers her head as if in a daze. She looks about at the people walking past, like she is only just noticing her surroundings.
Her halo suddenly begins to shine. All it would take is a momentary waver of the heart, and the empathy of the countless masses would come crashing down on this confused, lonely Sankta.
No, child.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Keep a tight grip on your gun!
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Ggh...
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: For a moment, Patrizion feels pain, but it is followed by a gentle, yet irrefusable comfort. It flows from her, from those enlightened creatures, from his people in the procession.
He knows his unusual reaction has been noticed, prompting the crashing waves of empathy, like seawater forcing its way back upriver.
Ah—
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Patrizion feels dizzy. He sighs, and slowly crouches down.
A moment later, the elderly gun-knight grips the barrel of the gunsmith's apprentice's gun, pointing it towards him.
Vannini. I got your name right, I hope?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Vannini, no matter how long it took you, or for what reason you did it, you made your very first patron firearm. That makes you a qualified gunsmith.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: But that is not enough. You must learn how to use it.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Now is a perfect opportunity.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Wh-What do you mean?
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: Keep it steady. Yes, just like that. Calm your mind, then, pull the trigger.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: You... You didn't kill Magister Paganini. Also, I'll fa... fall—
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: I am responsible for what happened to Pag, but this is not to avenge him.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: At this very moment, Laterano is walking down a new path. Faith flows into faith, and new prayers congregate into a collective consensus.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: You are too close to the procession. Empathy will soon swallow you whole. Only by falling can you break away.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Once you have fallen, I'll go guide the others. This is my duty, the duty of a gun-knight.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: I don't understand. Why... do you do this?
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: I don't really know myself, haha. I'm an old addlepate, after all.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: I always believed that, were Paradise to become a true paradise, our connections would become unbreakable.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: But what if in the course of all that, we lost more than we already had?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: We might ease our regrets, but when the time comes, what if our success has lost all meaning?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: If we were once all devils, if we once carried our sins together, how could our connections ever be broken?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: O glorious Sankta, O favored of faith, what have you to fear?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: (Pained inhalation)
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Vannini, girl, fear not falling into hell.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: This is the first lesson you should learn... and I'm right with you.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: It just never ends...
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: If this keeps on, I'm gonna have to start smacking them with my weapon!
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: Me too.
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: My hand's getting numb, can barely hold my staff.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Don't know how it's going on Fiammetta's side of things. According to the plan, once she sets the explosives, we'll blow up the plate's locking mechanisms and send all of Pagus Saint Marcel adrift.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: It'll also cut those monsters off from the Basilica.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Tsch. If we can hold on that long.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Dispersing Arrows!
Leave them to me!
These clothes...
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Landen Guard temporary solo combat team, Hildegard, at your service!
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Landen... Sorry, never heard of you.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: It's fine, I'm used to it, haha.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Some of my Sankta sisters are in that procession. We were running our business when we got called back, and then... we went through a whole bunch of stuff.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: How should I put this...? Even if everything that happened was fake, and Landen Monastery hasn't actually been given important responsibilities by the Curia...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: As long as I'm here, Laterano will once again remember the name of Landen Monastery!
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: These monsters might look strange, but they're hardly more of a challenge than the beasts of the great snowcapped mountains.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: I've got enough arrows, and I've got a sharp eye. I'll help you hold them off!
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: But we're all tired out, kid. We've racked our brains and put in the effort, but all we can do is keep falling back.
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: We're not exactly settling any grudges here. We came back to Laterano just to suffer again.
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: It's almost time, Mostima. Still no news from that Lemuen lady?
attributes.name: Fallen Angel

attributes.content: If we can't disengage the defenses on the plate lock mechanism, we won't be able to blow through their armor plating, right?
attributes.name: Fallen Angel

attributes.content: Let's just call it here then.
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: If those guys reach the Basilica, then what happens? Everyone more or less becomes Sankta?
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: What's that got to do with us?
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: Look around you. We can't even cobble together a single halo. Our long-awaited reinforcements are just one Liberi nun.
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: We've got an entire city's worth of people against us. Why do we Alieni have to hold all of them off?
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: Come now, that's not the best attitude to have right now...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Because right now, we're the only ones who can.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: We're always having to bust our asses doing things ordinary Sankta take for granted, right?
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: I had a little accident, as you can see. If I hadn't become a Legatus, I don't know what I'd be doing right now.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: I said I was going to be doing Messenger stuff when I left the Holy City, but I was just wandering around, really.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Wandering to places without any Sankta, places where these black horns on my head don't stand out, places where silent empathy's the norm...
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: It was hard.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: It took two whole years before I could look my friends in the eyes again without breaking out in a sweat.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Liberi, Fallen Angels, we're obsessed with assimilating or getting our old lives back. After putting in all that effort, why go with the hatchet job?
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Well, how about that.
I never thought I'd hear those words coming out of your mouth, Mostima.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Promise me you'll forget you heard anything.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Forget what?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: How did things go on your end?
attributes.name: Mostima
Fiammetta
attributes.content: Good news is, the bombs are in place.

attributes.name: Fiammetta
attributes.content: Bad news is, I was afraid they wouldn't be enough to blow through all the lock mechanisms, so I shoved the rest of my grenades in there with them...
Which means I'm all out of grenades to shoot at these things.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: (Halo rapidly flickers)
attributes.name: Enlightened Creature A

attributes.content: (Continuous sounds of prayer)
attributes.name: Enlightened Creature B

attributes.content: Hey, Fiammetta, let's blow this joint.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Wait! We still haven't heard anything from Lemuen. If the defenses aren't disengaged in time, all our explosives will go to waste!
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: Time to explosion, one minute!
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Wha-?
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: The timer starts ticking down in Fiammetta's hand. The enlightened creatures stop their prayers. As if sensing something is up, they throw themselves at her like rabid beasts.
Hildegard reaches for her quiver. It's empty.
Fifty seconds!
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Sorry, everyone! Hope I'm not too late!

A wheelchair suddenly brakes, throwing up a cloud of dust as it screeches across the ground. Its rider spins its left wheel as she hoists her rifle with her right hand, her long hair fluttering in the air.
You're right on time!
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Good to know we're still in sync!
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: The two of you will never guess how hard I beat my old wheelchair speed-shooting record by after I broke through their cordon around the Seventh Tribunal!
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Forty seconds!
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: I heard what you said just now. Fallen Angels, Liberi, Alieni... I'm inclined to use another term to sum up our relationship.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Friends, countrymen—Laterans!
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I've solved the permissions issue. The lock mechanism defenses are disengaged. Everyone, retreat to the Basilica doors! I'll hold these monsters off.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Thirty seconds!
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: You're going to shoot them, Lemuen? You'll fall!
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: I hate to admit it, but I can sense what you're thinking.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: So shut those mouths of yours. Laterano doesn't need to be saved! By you! Like this!
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: The click of bullets loading and the thrumming of the monsters' hearts reverberate through Lemuen's ears. She is nearly face-to-face with them, going against every sniper's instinct she has.
She listens to her own breathing, calm and steady.
Under these conditions, how fast can a sniper fire? Time to find out.
Lemuen, Cardinal of the Seventh Tribunal. In the name of Laterano's national security, I sentence you to death!
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: No matter the cost!
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Five seconds.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: It's done.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Lemuen, your halo... You alright? Feel anything weird?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Ngh—
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: A violent explosion tears through every inch of the ground in front of the Basilica, a rift plowing itself through the plaza.
On the other side of the rift, the grand procession shows itself as it marches forward.
Is that... El?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Hey, turns out it was my sis and her crew! They did a real bang-up job!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: (Wounded wail)
attributes.name: Enlightened Creature A

attributes.content: (Fragmented prayer)
attributes.name: Enlightened Creature B

attributes.content: Retreat somewhere safe, for the time being.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: A rift... One my people cannot cross. But we once forded raging rivers and traversed great valleys. Compared to those dangers, this is nothing.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: He lies ahead. I shall not stop.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: *cough* I... I never said I'd let you pass.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Your body is weak. I fear you have not an ounce of strength left. Am I wrong?
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Exusiai does not answer.
She has told herself the entire time to ignore how tired she feels, how strange falling makes her feel. She continues her barrage against the saint's colossal body, but once again to no avail.

The saint makes no move against her. Rather, she continues to cradle her, the same way she did when they left the dream. Never before has such a strange cradle been seen, one made from a malformed yet mighty arm.
Even though you know the entire truth of both past and present, even though you know we are working to create a new miracle, like the birth of Laterano...
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Even though you know our journey thus far has been to awaken our Lord, to ensure that in the future with but a hair's breadth separating destruction from continuation, the Sankta shall persist...
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Why do you still stand against us?
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Am I the only one?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: With empathy that strong, I don't believe for a second you can't feel it!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: After so many long years of waiting, I finally got my chance, but... it was all just a dream...
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: A dream's fine, too.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: If it's all a dream, then I don't have to worry about anything. Maybe getting shot here doesn't mean anything in reality!
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: If this is a dream, then I shall wake. If this is obsession, then I shall shatter it.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Let us only speak of redemption after that.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Vannini, girl, fear not falling into hell.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: This is the first lesson you should learn... and I'm right with you.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: East of the east of La Unidad♪ Laterano, holy city of white♪
attributes.name: Fearful Child

attributes.content: There, the earth hides no bombs♪ There, the fields share wheat most bright♪
attributes.name: Panicking Child

attributes.content: All shall bask in His love♪
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: I hate to admit it, but I can sense what you're thinking.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: So shut those mouths of yours. Laterano doesn't need to be saved! By you! Like this!
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I'm just an ordinary Lateran. Nobody important, and I don't have any special skills.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: So when I listened to you talk about the origins of the Sankta, the history of Laterano, the essence of faith, the crazy truth behind the life we're used to...
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: I was shocked! Shocked right down to my core!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: If things really are like you say, then the life we enjoyed in Laterano really is a kind of miracle.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: But since I'm just an ordinary Lateran, while you were explaining everything happening around us, all I noticed was...
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: How nobody looked happy at all.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Shouldn't Laterano be a happy place?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: If... If lots of our people will suffer when we complete this journey, how am I supposed to believe you can make the miracle happen?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Wait, no, scratch that, how am I supposed to believe it's a miracle in the first place?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: So, even if I wasn't around, there'd be other Sankta to stand against you.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: I shared all I have seen and all I have experienced, yet you still choose to turn away?
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: The path of the Sankta is a cruel one, our faith paved with sin and suffering.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Have their years inside this peculiar, distorted Paradise left our brethren so weak?
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Ugh, you're not getting me at all.
attributes.name: Exusiai
Exusiai
attributes.content: Maybe I should be asking what you asked me earlier—

attributes.name: Exusiai
attributes.content: Why you?
I have already told you my answer.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Even if this Terra-destroying calamity is real, and millions of Sankta are doomed, and Laterano's about to be completely screwed...
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Why are you, a 'Saint', the only one who can bring us salvation?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: We're the ones who live in this city right now, who enjoy its blessings, who went through its changes, and who protected it from destruction.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: You don't exist anymore. You're just a ghost! A string of code I can shoot!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Incorrect, my child. When I lifted my spear against my dying companion, the sleeping silver mounts answered me, and recorded my prayer for all eternity.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: All that is happening here and now is a continuation of that prayer.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Death cannot be undone, yet I wandered amongst His datastream. Together, we heard your prayers.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: No matter how appearances may change, no matter how the faith develops as time flows by, so long as the Sankta still pray, He shall operate eternally, and I shall forever be there...
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: The spiritual light will always shine on Laterano.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: This is our mission.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: ...Prayer is useless.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Pardon?
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: To be honest, I learned a long time ago that prayer is useless.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: When I was in my third year of primary school, an investigator from the Sixth Tribunal did an experiment at our school.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: She said there were two groups of patients at Faber Central Hospital with more or less the same conditions, and split us into our own two groups. One group would pray every day, while the other didn't have to do anything.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: But in the end, there wasn't any difference in their recovery. The investigator told us the results in class: prayer is useless.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Haha, it's funny, really. This country's full of churches, but it's always doing these kinds of 'outrageous' experiments.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: (Halo flickers)
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: You're right, Laterans really do pray to the Lord every day.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Praying they'll get better soon after getting sick, praying they'll pick the coolest guardian gun ever, praying the caravans won't run into Catastrophes on the way home, praying they'll never have to say goodbye to their friends...
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Praying that they'll be able to make it through all sorts of pain and suffering.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: But I never actually expected there to be a 'Lord' who would grant everyone's wishes, who would swoop in to save us when we're in trouble.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Empathy lets us sense the emotions of our people. It lets me know if the ones by my side are happy or sad.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: But prayer? Prayer doesn't just need me to sense things, it needs me to want to help my family and friends, to understand things outside of empathy.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: It even lets me feel like I could help some complete strangers get well sooner.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Even though I know it probably won't change a thing.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: I met lots of Sankta while running around with Penguin Logistics. You'd be hard pressed to call some of them Father, while others don't live life like we do in the Holy City anymore.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: But they were all so... fulfilled. I still felt close to them.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: I believe it's because we still prayed like we always did.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: It needs us to not doubt. It needs us to hold hope in our hearts.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Just being down to pray for each other is a beautiful thing in itself.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: It gives me a true connection to people.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: (Thunderous sigh)
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: If these connections were the foundation of faith, it would be exceedingly frail.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: No. I think it's exactly these connections that help hold our lives up.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: 'Survival'... 'Life'...
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: If you don't understand why Sankta these days are all about desserts and explosions—
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: What's up with you?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: (Fretful pacing)
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: The saint suddenly becomes exceptionally restless. She feels out the edge of the rift as she paces along it, her sharp front claws piercing the exposed, bent foundations, trying to find a way to climb down.
This rift you have opened allows me to sense His signal much more clearly.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: He is below the Basilica, calling out for me to approach—
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: No, no... Why is His signal in such disarray... He is anxious, uneasy...
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: The Creator has already revoked... or perhaps.... there are other threats forcing Him to... change...
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: The sound of machinery, faint yet clear, rises out from the depths of the rift below their feet.
The saint's unease becomes increasingly obvious. Half of her body has already entered the fault. Her claws clench, and Exusiai senses that she is in great pain.
Behind her, the procession stops, countless halos flickering over and over due to her worry, like a river of paralyzed stars.
Child, talks of past and present are meaningless... You need only step towards... the future...
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: You do not understand this crisis. There are no new solutions for you to find. You must... survive...
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: I said it before, I'm not letting you pass.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: How are you meant to stop... a ghost... a string of code...?
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: (Mournful roar)
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: The saint's voice becomes garbled. She has reverted to barely more than a beast, like the Teekaz who trudged through the mud all those years ago.
If we weren't in this mess, we could've been pretty good friends. A ghost, a string of code, the very first Sankta... There's no cooler friend than that!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Ah, silly me! Can't believe I forgot to introduce myself!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Lemuel of St. Theodore's Comprehensive School, number one student in the 84th Intercity Net Security preparatory course! And I've got the school certs to prove it!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Every bullet I got you with was custom-made! They just needed some time to take effect!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Her patron firearm howls once more. The force of the barrage finally frees Exusiai from the saint's grasp.
She leaps high into the sky.
We're not going to give up on life, obviously, but we're definitely not going to go with your plan.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: If refusing it means the halos connecting us will be cut off, then cut them off.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Because even if you do, we will never stop praying for each other.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: We'll still give thanks to the Lord for His existence, even if He isn't what we thought He was.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: O Lord, thank you for being there, for blessing us with bread and bullets, for being there for us during our trials and tribulations!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Thank you for spreading the light across Laterano all this time, giving everyone the chance for salvation!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Thank you for clearing the way for us!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Amen. There, prayer done.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Let's say bye-bye, the wildest way I know—
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: (Roars)
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Explosives fall like rain, linking together into a chain of blasts as they collide with the bullets embedded in the saint's body.
The saint howls, but not because of the explosions, not because of her flesh wounds, but because of the strange, dissonant sound caused by the 'ammunition' as it scrapes across her skin.
The sound of data being erased.
Divine judgment, traditional!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Rock n' gospel!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Barrage, sky-shattering!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Apple pie, with char siu!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.text: \n\nHumanity does not exist. Variable referred to as 'humanity' is a byproduct of Originium.

attributes.content: Originium?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: A... sea, made of Originium?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: It's like the sea back home. Calm, beautiful, but one nobody dares to set out on it.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Maybe, maybe not. This is familiar to you because... because the sea by your hometown is here. There's even a part of you here too.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: All things that are have been sealed here. A coffin for the world and everything upon it.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Like the crystals left behind by Oripathy patients after they die?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: If that helps you understand it, then yes.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Amazing, isn't it? This was once the end of everything.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: We are born far too late, our lives far too short. We even unconsciously take some inconsequential mishaps, and turn them into the foundation of our very being.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Like how you blindly took a shattered memory and turned it into divine revelation.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: But no matter. The Law wishes to bestow upon you true revelation.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: He says: 'None can be saved.'
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.text: Originium to Originium, dust to dust.
\n\nPersonnel with relevant privileges have provided PCS with new set of directives. Cognitive radiation amplifier at maximum output. Effective range: Terra.
\n\nOriginium will connect to PCS after maintenance is complete.

attributes.content: The Law created the Sankta from the Teekaz, built the order of Laterano in untamed wilds, and even attempted to establish a Terra-wide religion spanning multiple civilizations.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: He has worked for millennia in service of humanity. Surely it was not simply to turn all of it into Originium?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Is that truly the Law's ultimate goal?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.text: \n\nThis is the goal of Originium, not the goal of 'the Law'.
\n\nOriginium has been set as a prerequisite of 'the Law'.

attributes.content: If Originium is as you earlier described, able to assimilate everything, why is it a prerequisite to anything?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Surely it is more than the end of everything?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: How would the Law be able to operate inside a field of uniform Originium? What would be the meaning of a halo in that case?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.text: As Originium is the end of all things, there is meaning in bestowing halos on everything.
\n\nAngels after Originium are the only method of existence that will retain meaning.

attributes.content: 'None can be saved'?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: So not even Laterano as it is, a cramped Paradise, can be preserved?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: It cannot be saved, nor preserved.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: 'Save everyone' has never been a tenable commandment.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: All things march towards death. The only way to 'save' them is to see them off.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Grant them a dream, a bearing to hold themselves to. Hide their blemishes, espouse their brilliance.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: By doing so, you allow them to gladly accept their final journey.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Like how you saved yourself.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Granting dreams to others as a placebo?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: No. I won't accept that.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: If I have truly, shamelessly clung onto a false dream, put myself through a crucible for more than ten years...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: If I have debased myself by inflicting unhealing wounds upon countless others for the sake of self-salvation...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Then all the more reason not to spread this shamelessness and debasement to others.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Even if you accepted it, you are unable to perform such an act.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Only the Law can bestow such salvation.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: You can't possibly mean...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Keph's plan... was to give everyone halos, all so they can be granted this 'salvation'?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: But how would becoming Sankta help? Are Sankta beyond callousness, beyond cruelty, beyond... suffering?!
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: We shall not stop at becoming Sankta.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: We will all become true angels, Andoain Agathangelos.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: True... angels?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Aggy... Agathangelos? I don't like this name. It's too long and hard to read, and it doesn't sound like any of the other names here.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: This is... my surname. Before your father left, he kept telling me he hoped I would give it to you.
attributes.name: Sickly Woman

attributes.content: But, Mamma...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I know it's strange and hard to read, Andoain.
attributes.name: Sickly Woman

attributes.content: If the other children knew you had this name, they might say hurtful things to you like 'there's that weird boy!'.
attributes.name: Sickly Woman

attributes.content: Once you head out further afield, bandits may think you're a rich foreigner, while the Inquisition might assume you're a zealot up to no good.
attributes.name: Sickly Woman

attributes.content: Which is why I hope you never share it with others. Stick with a simple name, like the other orphans here.
attributes.name: Sickly Woman

attributes.content: I hope you will keep it in the deepest recesses of your heart, a place where your happiness, anger, sorrow and joy cannot touch.
attributes.name: Sickly Woman

attributes.content: But I feel really sad right now... I don't know if there's anywhere in me that doesn't feel sad.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Is there really a place like that in my heart?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Of course, Andoain. Everyone has one.
attributes.name: Sickly Woman

attributes.content: I hope that, when you think of this name, you will be free from suffering, grief, frustration, and strife.
attributes.name: Sickly Woman

attributes.content: Forget the dying and the hungry by the road who claw at your ankles. Forget those in despair, whose minds were eaten away by the sea fog, and the flesh they chew on.
attributes.name: Sickly Woman

attributes.content: Forget the monster doll your father made, and my finscale soup. Forget the storybook you keep beneath your pillow, and the brush you found in the old chapel.
attributes.name: Sickly Woman

attributes.content: But I don't want to forget them!
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: ...It's just for a little while, alright?
attributes.name: Sickly Woman

attributes.content: I hope that, when you think of this name, you will find tranquility... the tranquility of emptiness.
attributes.name: Sickly Woman

attributes.content: One day, you will need this peace.
attributes.name: Sickly Woman

attributes.content: Promise me, Andoain.
attributes.name: Sickly Woman

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: But I still want to know what this name means.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: 'Angel'. In Lateran, it means... 'Angel'.
attributes.name: Sickly Woman

attributes.content: Tranquility... Yes, a very apt descriptor.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Behold. Even as they come, they do so in silence.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: The ocean of Originium is endless. Those who look upon it soon realize that every observation they make of it is without meaning.
When everything the eye can see is impossible to differentiate, where to start looking is similarly impossible to determine.
But now, above this great sea of uniformity, something shines.

It is as if the edge of the Originium sea has converged into a river that flows into the heavens. Countless fragments of Originium rise up from the surface of the sea, floating up into the distant, empty beyond in perfect formation.
The fragments are jagged and irregular. Some are as small as dust, others as immense as stars, but all, without exception, are crowned with a glimmer of light.
A glimmer shaped like a ring.
Halos...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Beautiful, aren't they?
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: It's a pity that all the beauty and ugliness in the world is meaningless to angels.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Angels are neither beautiful nor ugly. They are neither high nor low, noble nor base, reverent nor blasphemous, adorant nor disdainful.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: They know neither meeting nor separation, happiness nor suffering.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Can they even be considered life?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Does that matter? All the praise we heap upon life is nothing but egotistical admiration.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Observing their forms in an attempt to compare them to our definition of life is simply us trying to find resonance with them.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Then, are they the Law? Are they gods?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: If there is no distinction between beauty and ugliness, high and low, noble and base, why would there be one for god and worshiper?
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Angels do not understand faith. They simply exist in the furthest reaches of the universe, taking on the most distinctive forms.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: It was our forebears who encountered them, shamelessly disturbing them as they did so. In their name, we created a forgery of a dialectic, of god and worshiper.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: If all our emotions, ideas and actions have nothing to do with angels...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: What does our future have to do with them?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: It is because everything we are has nothing to do with angels that we should become them.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Now, this is only a possibility, but...
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: When the Creator descends, when everything is submerged into this ocean before us, a time of stasis, uniformity, and meaninglessness...
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: The Sankta within can take on the forms of angels and enjoy an eternal existence, where they shall shine forevermore.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: This is the final answer we shall submit to death.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: This is His gift to the people He has guarded for thousands of years, His final blessing and salvation.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.text: We drift, just as we drift between past and future.
We flicker, just as we flicker between reality and the void.
Angels know not beginnings or ends. Angels know not increase or decrease. Angels know not life or death.
In an existence where nothing exists, we can only exist in the form of angels.

attributes.content: So these are true angels?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Incomprehensible to the point where the Law cannot directly describe them, instead defining them by what they are not?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Immaterial to the point where taking the form of angels allows one to continue to exist after becoming Originium?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: This is the existence the Law has chosen once everything returns to Originium?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: If this is the ultimate purpose of the Law, then as a saint and an executor, I should implement and enforce it.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Unless...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Unless the Law itself is a paradox.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I have one final question!
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Explain to me how, if angels truly are as you say, without beginning or end, increase or decrease, life or death...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Then why do they—you—have such a strong desire to exist... to continue to exist?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: As machines have inputs, so they have outputs.
The saints sought answers in the Law, and the Law granted them revelation.
The fleet asked the system for instructions, so the system issued commands.
The Lord, or rather, PCS, has never been as silent as it is now.
You are an artificial system, so you require people to operate you. This is true for both a 'command system' and the Law worshiped by the Holy City.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The ultimate purpose you were given was to break humanity free from their shackles and return their angelic nature.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: However, this purpose, does it stem from people, or from angels?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Why would the angels you described desire this? Their actions do not have purpose, assuming they can even perform actions other than 'drift' and 'flicker'.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But if this purpose comes from people, how will you turn them into angels?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Surely everything you have done was more than just—
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Nurturer, I shall now grant you salvation.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Guide your people to angelification. Guide yourself.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Be free from suffering, grief, frustration, and strife. You will obtain tranquility, the tranquility of emptiness, as shall those you have helped and harmed alike.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: You need not live as an egotist, a villain, a traitor, or a fanatic. Nor do you need to die as one.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Andoain feels more tired than he has ever been before, as if an entire lifetime's worth of burdens have been pressed down onto his back at once.
The arborbeast was right. He really is like that Sarkaz drunkard, acutely aware this is the last chance he has.
If he wanted relief, this is the only way.
'Relief'. He only needs to hear the word's crisp syllables to feel joy, to want to fall to the ground and weep until he has spent all his strength, then fall further into a deep slumber.
But he uses that strength to instead open his clouded eyes.
I don't know what kind of answer His Holiness gave you, nor do I know what Mostima, Fiammetta, Lemuen or her little sister are thinking right now aboveground.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I don't know where Patia and our former fellows are headed, nor do I know whose bosom the children I tended in the Shrine of Nurtury have clutched.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I don't know if they want this salvation, this relief.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: But if what you really care about is my answer as a 'suitable candidate'...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Then my answer is no.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I'm far too conceited. Even to this very moment, I still refuse to believe my arduous search for answers, decades in the making, was all for this simple relief.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I'm not only conceited, I'm an egotist, a villain, a traitor, and a fanatic. And so I suffer and grieve, my frustrations giving rise to strife.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: But they are the foundations of my life.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: If I were to abandon them, the one who obtains relief, who becomes an angel, would not be me.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Andoain Agathangelos shall never obtain relief.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Nor will he ever wish for it!
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Let suffering scar his flesh, let strife snap his bones! Then, and only then, will he have the clarity of mind to walk his path!
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: It seems we have reached an agreement.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The Law itself is a paradox. He cannot be implemented, nor should He be.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Andoain, we must correct Him... or stop Him, if He cannot be corrected.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.text: \n\nDerived abnormal node: PCS, Personality and Cognition Synchronization system.
\n\nDerived abnormal node: The Law, God, Laterano.

attributes.content: 'Continue'. A scientist input this command.
'Survive'. A Teekaz howled this.
And so, an imitator of angels began its endless yet transient pilgrimage.
The imitator of angels became a command system, became the Law, became a god, yet it could not become an angel.
'Wish' and 'angel' are incompatible.
What information is He waiting for?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I've said all I can say.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: If God wishes me to embrace death as an angel...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Then I would rather be born as a human, with all the ugliness, transience, and suffering that entails.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.text: \n\nRe-exporting solution: must eliminate abnormal nodes and derived abnormal nodes.

attributes.content: God's final commandment... is to kill God.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Even if He was a paradox, he was still the foundation of the Paradise of Laterano. With His death, the Sankta will no longer be linked by empathy or receive guidance from the Law.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Like an infant trapped within a womb, biting apart its umbilical cord and crawling its way out of its mother's cold body, helpless as it faces a land steeped in cruelty.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: But it is only in such a land that we can be called truly human.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: That we can have the right to talk about salvation.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Law or God, I will kill you.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: The commandment is rational and feasible.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Assist me, Andoain.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Whew—
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Arturia leans against her cello. Finally. She frees a hand and holds it against her chest, allowing herself to catch her breath.
Nearly there. If my memory serves me correctly, I just head down this corridor to return to the surface.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Oh, you patrols truly are relentless.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: (Restless gasping)
attributes.name: Shrine Patrol A

attributes.content: (Halo flashing rapidly)
attributes.name: Shrine Patrol B

attributes.content: The wispy guards surround Arturia, attempting to drag her back underground. She has wasted far too much time inside this maze since she turned away from the machine.

Her patron firearm is lost. She has no desire to join her pursuers in prayer, or to perform their hearts' songs. She would rather destroy her own cello... Arturia has never found herself in such a predicament before.
The exit is right ahead, but she no longer has the strength to carry on.
The ground...?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Fede, what did you—
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*... Urgh...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The dust settles, and Arturia can finally see again.
The explosion earlier created a giant pit, one that connects to the rift in the plaza above, exposing the bowels of the Basilica to all.
A ring-shaped machine lies at the bottom of the pit quietly.
Sunlight shines upon it, but it has lost its radiance.
There it stands, as dull as a rock.
Unease.
This is the second time Arturia has felt this feeling so clearly, the first being the time she faced the Witch King in his Pavillon.
Deep within her body, somewhere she cannot see, things that were always linked together quietly break apart. There is no mistaking the feeling.
She breathes in deep. The moment she closes her eyes, countless similar melodies rush into her mind like the tide.
*sniffle*... *sob*...
attributes.name: Sankta Child B

attributes.content: You're crying, why...?
attributes.name: Sankta Child A

attributes.content: Why does your crying sound so annoying?!
attributes.name: Sankta Child A

attributes.content: You're annoyed? I-I can't feel it.
attributes.name: Sankta Child B

attributes.content: Sorry, I'm so sorry... But I'm scared!
attributes.name: Sankta Child B

attributes.content: It's like that time Seniora Serpilia locked me in a dark room. I can hear your voices clearly, but I can't hear what you're saying...
attributes.name: Sankta Child B

attributes.content: My connection with our enlightened companions has been... severed...
attributes.name: Velliv

attributes.content: No, not just them... You're right here, Reverend Patrizion, but... I can't even...
attributes.name: Velliv

attributes.content: Sense me, I know.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Wuh... Waaaahhhh....
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: Be a good girl and don't let go of my hand—
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Your hand... That's not what your hand feels like...
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: It's like... mist.
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: Far away... You're so... far away from me.
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: ...So, this is what it's like to fall into hell?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: The changes do not end with her own body. Some old jokes have come true.
Every light we know will one day be extinguished.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: And it is no exception.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: The old Pope playfully points to the halo hovering above his head.
Even if everything about the Sankta existence is interpreted as 'its' boon?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Unease grows, and panic spreads.
Arturia tries to make sense of it all. This is not the same as what happened in Zwillingstürme. There is no malevolent force sowing discord among the emotions of the people this time around.
It is like a movement, one played countless times by an orchestra of the masses, had part of its melody forcibly plucked away, as if it never existed.
Like walking along a road with the sun, the rain, your friends and your home ahead of you, but you are torn away from it for no reason, leaving you feeling alone and helpless...
Alongside millions of your people.
'The Sankta will lose the cozy cabin of their faith'... Everything has come to pass.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Did you fail, Fede?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: If you're scared, you can hold onto my tail.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: You noticed Giselle's tears, didn't you, Romya? Have you forgotten what tears mean?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Let's finish our song, okay?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: You see, Laterano hymns and Bolívarian hymns are quite different, so we need time to teach each other the parts we don't know.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: We will be here, together.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: East of the east of La Unidad♪
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: L-Laterano, holy city of white♪
attributes.name: Panicking Child

attributes.content: ...There, the earth hides no bombs♪
attributes.name: Fearful Child

attributes.content: There, the fields share wheat most bright♪
attributes.name: Children

attributes.content: All shall bask in His love♪
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Arturia hears singing.
It wavers, revealing the anxiety, terror and worries of the singers... alongside pure, honest longing.
A longing for tranquility, to see night fall in peace and quiet.
Your Holiness, I have no doubt that Laterano as it is may be walking to its demise.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But I also believe it has never been this sincere.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I've said before that I can't hold off the apocalypse or overwrite death, and I refuse to lead.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But maybe my Arts can help them stave off this oncoming collapse.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: They will let my brethren, free of empathy, to 'communicate' without reservation, purely and honestly.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Go listen to those songs. Go share your emotions. Go tell one another that, at this very moment, in the face of this indescribable loss, we still feel joy and sorrow together.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: This has nothing to do with saints and sinners, redemption and responsibility, or whichever path I walk.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: This is simply my reason to exist.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Laterano, holy city of purest white, falls into night. But today, there may not be an electrical operator named Alcide there to turn on the city lights.
Arturia takes off her gloves.
She decides to play towards the setting sun.
To her heart's content.
